intro: Viola lasiostipes, commonly known as the woolly violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves that are covered in dense, woolly hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. The plant produces showy violet-blue flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in ecological studies of high-altitude flora.
